segments.text: My gaze returns to the woman, still so absorbed in her dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s completely oblivious to the rising water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can anyone be so unaware of their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of inattention is frankly irritating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just rushing over the edge, ruining the cabinet doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me a bit angry to see such a preventable mess unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the children! Their audacity to steal cookies right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is clearly unstable; it could give way at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost picture the boy toppling backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels like a series of poor choices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone should really intervene before things get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s hard to just stand by and watch this impending doom.
segments.speaker: PAR
